fields.description:
When edtiting any page, the tabs for Wiki Markup, Rich Text and Preview do not respond in Firefox. Opening Java Console shows 'Not Defined' errors for $, DWREngine, Ajax and DraftAjax.

This appears to be related to cached JavaScript that is either corrupt, not being permitted to run, or non-existent. 

Cannot replicate the error by upgrading local versions and has only occured on confluence.atlassian.com. Appears unrelated to upgrades as this first appeared some time after the most recent CAC upgrade to 2.2.9.

This error may be purely browser-related but is not related to extensions, or non-default Java and cache settings. The workaround is to clear the cache.

If any user encounters this error, please comment.

fields.description:
A very long Message ID seems to be causing error as per example below:

2006-09-29 15:16:08,953 DEBUG [sf.hibernate.type.StringType] nullSafeSet binding '<!~!@amberpoint.com>' to parameter: 1


which consequently appears to cause the error below:


2006-09-19 19:00:41,638 ERROR [sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] logExceptions Data truncation: Data truncated for column 'MESSAGEID' at row 1


After the user located that MESSAGEID in entities.xml file and modified it to a shorter string things seems to be working OK. 

He did some further research into the problem and discovered that a "Recall" message submitted by an email sender is the cause of a huge messageId within Confluence. Note that this message also has an attachment named "winmail.dat". I'm not sure if the attachment has anything to do with the naming problem.

In his case, the message was supposed to be recalled from Confluence's email archive.

Can we please look into this matter to confirm that Confluence can handle long message IDs and what are the limits as for the string length?

Thanks,
Ivan
fields.summary: "Recall" message generated by an e-mail client generating extensively long messageId breaking Confluence import

[!myImage.png|thumbnail!|^myAttachment|myToolTip]

Any of syntax below will yield a FULLSIZE image that is a link to an attachment and the tool tip WILL appear.

I would like to be able to display a thumbnail image as a link to an attachment and be able to display a tool tip but cannot do so.

fields.description:
The descriptions under Page Edit -> Restrictions are not accurate and this is causing confusion. 

The 'No restriction' permission silently applies a restriction hierarchy
View = Space View AND Page View
Edit = Space View AND Space Edit AND Page View

The Group restriction is fails for multiple groups without explanation

Recommendation -
For Page 'View', change "No restriction" checkbox to "Users with Space 'View' "
For Page 'Edit', change "No restriction" checkbox to "Users with [Space 'Create'|spacepermissions.action?key=some_space] and Page 'View' "
For both, change "Group" to "Single Group"
fields.summary: Page Restriction labels are inaccurate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7089].
{panel}
This is the ability to add page permissions for users and groups at the page level. This is different than issue -CONF-3701- which talks about restricting permissions.

In many instances customers have offered a scenario where they have a somewhat restricted space but want to open up individual pages to a larger audience. For instance a technical team might want to open up a specification page to a larger audience, but don't want to open up everything and don't want to create a new space just for the spec. page.

This might be similar to a scaled down version of the process by which users and groups are given access to view and edit spaces....though this feature would be just for individual pages with the control most likely being offered on the page itself, as with the ability to restrict access.

This is a related issue, though not clearly defined: -CONF-5682-

There is also the case where a page needs to be open to viewing by anonymous users in a space which is otherwise inaccessible. If this issue were implemented, the UI should allow permitting anonymous access. (This was originally raised as -CONF-10316-.)

{panel:title=Atlassian Update, October 29 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi all,

Thanks for all your votes and comments on this suggestion.

We’re planning on making a number of improvements to Confluence permissions over the coming 6-9 months, and this is one of the suggestions we’re strongly considering implementing. We fully appreciate the current difficulties involved in not being able to ‘add’ page restrictions within a hierarchy which is overall more restrictive.

We haven’t started investigating the complexities involved in potentially implementing this suggestion yet, but we’ll provide you with an update once this investigation start.

Best
 Jenny | Confluence Server Product Manager

{panel}
fields.summary: create the ability to 'add' page permissions for users and groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7087].
  {panel}

Perhaps the biggest hurdle to adoption of Confluence is that its markup differs from MediaWiki, or from wiki-xyz.

To test the waters regarding switching from MediaWiki, I used the (unsupported, 3rd-party volunteer) converter, which is imperfect at best.  For a few dozen pages this took days. For various reasons, my organization decided to put off switching until later, if ever, when we will have even more content in MediaWiki at which time the process will be even harder.  We probably will never convert as a result.

The right architectural solution to this, I suggest, might be to store the pages as HTML and to provide plug-in converters to-from Confluence markup and MediaWiki markup. Import/export specifies which dialect to use, and each user specifies their preference for dialect.

This architecture would solve the conversion problem: you simply designate that the files being imported are marked up with MediaWiki formatting. And it would solve the user problem: users already fluent in MediaWiki markup need never switch to Confluence markup.
fields.summary: Store pages as HTML - allow editing in either Confluence or MediaWiki markup dialect

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7084].
  {panel}

We have ~1G of attachments.

Simultaneously migrated:
 - Confluence from 2.2.5 to 2.2.9
 - the attachments from the file system to the DB
 - JVM from 256mb max to 512mb max.

The backups now throw an OutOfMemory exception.  Even if I _de-select_ the option "Backup Attachments" Confluence still attempts to load the entire recordset into Hibernate memory, resulting in the exception.

I understand that we can use a MySQL backup and a replica of the Confluence Home directory, however an integrated backup would be nicer for our system -- and even an automated backup with attachments would be very nice to have.  We have been stung in the past with using this restore process failing (since appropriate changes to the database schema are not made when you restore direct to the DB instead of using Confluence).

I propose a change to the backup process to use a streamed-out ZIP file, or at the least not requiring full load into RAM of the entire JVM recordset (instead of doing an eager load of the db, just load one record at a time ... )
fields.summary: Change backup process to stream to disk

fields.description: We would like for the access log to record the remote host, so that we can get statistics on who is accessing the site and also filter out anonymous accesses from our organization. If users are anonymous, it is impossible to tell whether they are external or internal users.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7082].
  {panel}

The {children} macro is heavily used to create quick, dynamic links to subpages; extremely useful when starting a section.

As the section matures, often some pages start to need aliases or we want to specify a static order, so the children list is replaced with a list of hard-coded links. These are no longer dynamic.

It would be excellent to be able to use a {children:unique=true} or {children:unlinked=true} or something like that to specify I would like to make a summary list of all children of this page which are *NOT OTHERWISE LINKED* from this page. That way, you could make a static list:

[my child page one|some page name]
[my child page three]
[my child page two]
{children:unlinked=true}

which would list in an arbitrary manner the indexed sub-pages, but would also be dynamically extensible.

Thanks

fields.description:
At present, users cannot create links to pages without revealing the page title. If a user wishes to link to a restricted page, they must reveal it's existence. If users wish to maintain private pages as completely secret, the only current workaround is never to link to those pages.

However, they can use the page's tiny link with a harmless alias to create a completely secret link. For example "The finance team should check out [this page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/8usC]" is generic enough to be publicly viewable without compromising security. To implement this, page behaviour for hidden pages should duplicate nonexistent pages:

1) TinyURL should check page permissions for a user when the TinyURL is accessed and go to 'Page Not Accessible' if 'View' permission is not granted. 

2) Replace TinyURL 'Page Not Found' error with "Page Not Accessible". Current message is "The page you were trying to reach does not exist. You may want to try a search, or browse the site to find the page you were looking for." This should be updated for anonymous viewers:

"Page Not Accessible
The page either does not exist, or you must be logged in to view it. You can [login or sign-up for an account here]. Alternatively, you can browse the site for other public pages."

For logged-in users without View access, the page should state that they may need further permissions:

 "Page Not Accessible
The page either does not exist, or you do not have permission to view it. If you believe this page exists and you should have permission to access it, please [contact your administrator]. Alternatively, you can browse the site for another page."
fields.summary: Link to restricted pages that don't reveal page space/title - make tinyURLs give 'Page Not Found' if user lacks View permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7068].
  {panel}

When users manually accessed a URL that they do not have view permission for, they are redirected to the Login action, but no explanation is provided. Redirecting to unexpected pages should provide a reason.

When the login action receives an os_destination, it should provide an error message indicating "You must login to access this page"

Optionally, the Login action can parse the context path to check if the URL is a Confluence page and list the page title attempting to be accessed. For example, on
http://localhost:8080/login.action?os_destination=%2Fdisplay%2Fds%2FHome

You must login to access 'Home'
fields.summary: Add denial reason when redirecting manually accessed pages to login action

fields.description:
Ths dynamic tasklist can easily break templates. When creating a new page from a template that contains both variables and the dynamic tasklist, attempting to add a new task removes page content and switches to 'insert variables' mode. This does not occur when variables are not used.

Also, calling {dynamictasklist:one} from a template and viewing the preview shows 'Error formatting macro: dynamictasklist: java.lang.NullPointerException'

Current workaround is to know not to create dynamic tasks until after the page has been created, but the tasklist should not render in template variable insertion mode unless it can be used from within that mode without erasing page content.
fields.summary: Dynamic Tasklist Macro cannot be used while creating a page from a template

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7062].
  {panel}

When users sign up to a public instance and make their email their username, it becomes public accessible to all users. Users should be aware that this may publicise their email for spammers. Current sign-in text appears as:

"Your username will be used to log in to Confluence. This must be unique: for example John Smith could use jsmith. Alternatively you can use your email address as your username."

The public email risk could be emphasised by rewriting the login text similar to below:

"Your username is used to login. When choosing, select a username that is unique and includes your first name. Alternatively you can use your email address as your username, though this makes your email viewable publicly viewable."
fields.summary: Spam/privacy risk from using email as username on public instances should be empahsised

fields.description: Some links in digest email does not use $baseurl prefix. It seems that the issue in macro #contentLink2 that is referenced from changedigest-notification.vm.
fields.summary: Some digest notification links don't include the base URL

fields.description:
I just confirmed today that when you install a plugin via the plugin repository on a clustered confluence (the extranet, in this case) it doesn't install on both nodes. In both of my tests, it only installed on atlassian11 (if that tells you anything).

Uploading thru the normal admin interface does install on both nodes.

Uninstalling normally deletes from both nodes.

Uninstalling from the plugin repository deletes from both nodes(!).

Despite the fact that the plugin only exists on one node, it still loads successfully, which is good. If you're not watching the filesystem, you wouldn't necessarily notice anything was wrong.
fields.summary: Plugin Repo doesn't place nicely with clustering

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7057].
  {panel}

I've seen a few customers who wish to make their user lists less public.  For example CONF-5550 requests the ability to not notify of changes to user profiles.

Another way the user lists are publicised is by the Space Admin -> Permissions page.  

This page gives all space administrators (including personal space administrators) the ability to do wildcard searches for users and for groups. 

A customer has suggested that there should be global permissions allowing "search for users" and "search for groups" and that space administrators without these permissions can only give permissions to users and groups that they know the names of.
fields.summary: Revoking permission to search for users and groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7051].
  {panel}

Our Wiki is running disconnected from the internet in a save environment. So it is not possible to run the "recommended" repository-plugin.

For example, some tools like Maven allow to connect to a Mirror of a repository. This Mirror could be hostet in the intranet and the client could connect to it, to work like now.

Or the client could be fed with a summary-list to check the local plugins whether they are up to date. Then they could be downloaded manualy without checking each single one.

Or the client could work offline, to browse just through a detailed plugin-table.

cheers
Frank
fields.summary: Allow the Repository-Client to run disconnected from Atlassian

fields.description:
A space cannot be deleted. The problem is that Label.hbm.xml -> confluence.label_unused uses a sub select (aka sub query). Sub selects have been introduced in MySQL version 4.1.

Fix: Rewrite the statement to use a LEFT JOIN:

select distinct {l.*} from LABEL l LEFT JOIN CONTENT_LABEL lc ON l.LABELID = lc.LABELID where lc.LABELID IS NULL

BTW: Regarding to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Installation+Guide MySQL version 3.2 is supported.
fields.summary: Confluence 2.2.9 does not work with MySQL version prior to 4.1

fields.description:
A customer has discovered that Grouping Search results by space omits some results.  I haven't looked into which results exactly get omitted, but it's nothing really obvious like those in "personal spaces" or "emails".  

For example.  Search the Extranet for "drink beer" in all spaces for all content (No Mail).  13 results are returned.  Group By Space gets only 10.

Similar results on a much larger scale occur when searching confluence.atlassian.com for "confluence" or "fancy".  I haven't done a search that hasn't shown this bug yet.
fields.summary: Search: Group by Space removes results from favourite spaces

fields.description:
As far as I can tell there is no way put a commend in the wiki markup, like
# blah 
// blah
/* blah */
;; blah
<!-- blah -->

This is a source code language which is used to produce a product that is a rendering of the source code.  It should be obvious that there is a need to be able to put comments in here to be seen only by people looking at the source code and not to be seen by people looking at the rendered result.

It is absurd to have a markup source code language with no comment convention.
fields.summary: markup language comment syntax!
Page Comparison should be optionally made in Rich Text format too, along with Wiki markup language

fields.description:
Summary:
contentbylabel throws Java errors when embedded into a BLOG or COMMENT object

Discussion:
I was trying to include a list of content pages from a different space by using the contentbylabel macro.  I discovered the following:

* the macro works fine when embedded in a PAGE object;
* the macro will work in page preview mode when a new BLOG object is created but then will give a Java error on subsequent viewings of that BLOG object.
* the macro will give a Java error when embedded in a COMMENT object.

Proof of Concept:
I uncovered this problem on my Confluence 2.2.5 but I was easily able to replicate it in Atlassian's Confluence 2.2.9 test space.  See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/2006/09/23/contentbylabel+macro+test+in+news

Sample Macro Call:
{contentbylabel:permissions|key=CONF20}
fields.summary: contentbylabel macro throws Java errors when used in BLOG or COMMENT objects

We performed an upgrade last night and now we are getting errors on page load and when we try to edit any page on our own Confluence server. 

There is no exception thrown in the logs whatsoever. The only relevant information we found is here:
    - http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-4741
    - http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=8829&tstart=0
    - http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/mail/134951

We verified the suggestions from the above links and we comply with them, but it still doesn't work. 

This is affecting our business as we use Confluence for internal communication. Your immediate response will be appreciated.
fields.summary: Error on page load and edit after upgrade to 2.2.9
Emoticons :P and :D cannot be escaped

fields.description:
Wiki markup for graphical emoticons is not escaped when inserted into the rich text editor.

To replicate:
1) Edit a page
2) Switch to rich text editor 
3) Enter :-) :-( :P :D ;) (y) (n) (i) (/) (x) (!)(+) (-) (?) (on) (off) (*) (*r) (*g) (*b) (*)
4) Switch to preview

Users should not have to escape text inserted using the rich text editor.
fields.summary: Wiki markup for graphical emoticons not escaped by rich text editor

fields.description: There is a problem with the add page redraw functionality in Confluence. He tried to save the page and he omitted to put in a page name (see screenshot 1). It is not surprising because these is no 'Title' or 'Location' supporting text. He presumably then thought the page was saved as there was no error message. I mimicked his actions only to find no supporting text or errors appearing until I tried to highlight the blank areas around the title field. See attachment 2 for this. The 'error' and 'title', 'location' fields are not visible unless you try and highlight the blank space.
fields.summary: Add Page with no title gives no error and does not save
Function to merge Spaces

fields.description:
view change is work incorrectly. 

I maked page with content like below,
a
b
c

and I edit page like below,
e
f
g

Diff line count is 3. But I view only first line's letter as Attachment image.

I view source. And detect problem point.

In diffLine() method on DiffUtils class, run next method always after for loop.

setDiffMode(DIFF_MODE_NONE);

so, next line's diff mode is always DIFF_MODE_NONE without first line (first line's diff mode is DIFF_MODE_CHANGE_DELETE).

I want to view all line in diff. Unix's diff command is also view all diff line's info. isn't it?

Or is this logic your policy?

I wait your comment. Happy day~~  :-)
fields.summary: view change is work incorrectly.

This is not accurate for groups that do exist, so a more appropriate error message might be "You are not a member of group"

fields.description: If you have a plugin that uses XStream to serialize some objects, and you upgrade the plugin to a new version, XStream keeps a cache of introspection data for the old version of the serialized classes. So if you've modified those classes, XStream will blow up until the server is restarted.
fields.summary: XStream introspection cache not cleared when plugin upgraded

all is good

There is no action mapped - should this be translated in this instance into "Sorry mate, that plugin is disabled". Is it possible?

fields.description:
Currently, PluginEvent subclasses only contain the human-readable name of the plugin. They should contain the plugin key instead, for two reasons:

1) The plugin key is what is used to retrieve individual plugins in the PluginManager and are guaranteed to be unique.
2) The name is intended to be human-readable and is not supposed to be used programatically. It's also not guaranteed to be unique.

The upshot of this is that when receiving plugin events, the only information you are given is basically useless. If it's a PluginInstallEvent or a PluginEnableEvent you can trawl through the whole list of installed plugins and check the name manually, but you are not guaranteed that the real source of the event was another plugin with the same name.

However, if it's a PluginUninstallEvent or a PluginDisableEvent, you can't even do that, since the plugin no longer shows up in the list!

This is most annoying and renders the events practically useless. Please fix!
fields.summary: PluginEvents do not contain the plugin key the event is associated with.
